english_translation: There was a writing office of Ibrahim in Radhān, and on that area there was Hawshab ibn Yazid al-Shaybani. The troops sought permission to visit their families, so he granted them permission and set a deadline for them, saying: "Whoever is absent beyond the deadline, I will strike him one stripe for each day." I said to Ibrahim: "You stay as long as you wish, there is no displeasure for you." So he stayed beyond the deadline twenty days. Father presented the people and had marked on each man's name what he was absent. He kept striking them until he called Ibrahim. He was absent twenty days beyond the deadline. He ordered regarding him, and we stood up to him, and we were ten brothers. He said to us: "Whoever's mother is a free woman, then she is divorced, and whoever's mother is a slave woman, then she is free, if you do not sit down and do not speak, until I carry out my order regarding him as I have carried it out regarding others." So we sat until he struck him twenty stripes.
